snippet: Alvin L. Watts, 32, and Jacob C. England, 19, are accused of killing three black people and wounding two others in a shooting spree that terrified the Oklahoma city over the Easter weekend.
abstract: Alvin L Watts and Jacob C England, men accused of killing three black people and wounding two others in a shooting spree in Tulsa, Okla, over the Easter weekend, confess to the police shortly after their arrest; officials say it is still too early to determine if the shootings were racially motivated.

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Tulsa, and Channing Joseph from New York.

lead_paragraph: Alvin L. Watts, 32, and Jacob C. England, 19, are accused of killing three black people and wounding two others in a shooting spree that terrified the Oklahoma city over the Easter weekend.

headline.seo: Two Suspects Confessed in Tulsa Shootings
headline.main: 2 Tulsa Shooting Suspects Confess, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Two Suspects Confessed in Tulsa Shootings That Killed Three, Police Say
